column2: Murph, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had my first Orencia Infusion on July 30.  There was no problem the first 24 hours.  I became increasingly sick with severe flu-like symptoms.  My white count at the time of the infusion was 12, (high because of a back injection I'd had one week prior).  After getting sicker and sicker, I went to the ER on August 5 and my white count was 15.5.I have all-over body pain, mouth pain (but no sores) headache, and fatigue.  I was given a shot in the ER and put on Keflex for 10 days.  I had bad chills which went away after the shot.  All other symptoms remain.  I am frightened.  The hospital personnel said they have never had a patient who had bad side effects.

column2: KikiB, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: on this treatment for 10 months and worked well in the begginning and somewhere around the 6 month mark it began to lose its effectiveness. Have ried multiple oral medicines and Humira, and remincade also.

column2: :)marie, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have severe RA. Inflammation #'s off the charts.Orencia has been a lifesaver for me.  My only complaints have been extreme tiredness, and VERY sensitive skin on my arms and legs.  Feels like constant sunburn - never lets up. I'm not sure that it's from the Orencia, but can't imagine what else can be causing this.  I find little or no info from others regarding this issue.  I would certainly appreciate any feedback.Thank you.:)marie

column2: Jt, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I also have MS and have been feeling so bad lately I wonder if this drug is stimulating the ms.

column2: Want to be, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: During infusion and afterwards for 30 hours I feel sick, forgetful, and systemically ill.  However the treatment gives me 4 good weeks.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got this as a study drug it worked well, but then the fda approved it i start getting it and the first time i got it i had an allergic reaction to it. I got it again and was fine, but after about 4 doses it stopped working.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Only been on this drug, by Injection, for two months. No change in pain levels. Have had bouts of vertigo and weakness. I also have MS and wonder if this drug is causing my ms to be  worse . Prior to starting this drug the ms wasn't to un bearable.

column2: jeri, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Orencia infusion for 3 years and have had no serious side-effects as yet. Prior to Orencia I was on Enbrel for a year and Humeria for another year and had major side-effect with them.  So far I am very pleased with Orencia.

column2: dncferrets, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: it worked real well for a year then has slowed down and become less effective

column2: Georgia, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Orencia for 18 months and it has put my RA in remission finally after 5 years of pain.  After the first 6 treatments I have no side effects.  Love Orencia, it has given me my life back@

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: BEWARE....I'm a 35 year old female who has had RA for 3years. I had my first infusion Jan 24, 2012. After my first couple of minutes into it I had a reaction my ears started itching. Then they slowed my I V down but it didn't help by the time I knew what was going on my throat was swelling shut. I had to be rushed to the ER my eyes was bloody and I had swelling on the brain. So be VERY careful not saying this will happen to you but don't think anything is little when it comes to having a reaction. The doctor said that they had never had anyone have a reaction to this drug. I started with my ears itching then hives around them then wheezing started then the bloody eyes. I'm counting my blessings and I'm so greatful for my husband and my doctor and only being a few feet away from the hospital. I was very lucky!!!!!!

column2: VVH, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I really don't know what to say about this treatment. I just started 2 1/2 weeks ago and I still feel stiffness and pain 4/10 in both wrists and right ankle. I feel blue and very scared that this treatment may not work for me, I have tried several other treatments. I've been dealing with RA since I was 17, now I'm 35 so if there's anybody that has tried this treatment that has felt the same way please let me know. Thank you in advance.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
HBeachmom, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Orencia for just 2 months and I am finally feeling normal again.  I was told that Orencia takes at least 6 weeks for it to "kick in".  I used to be on Remicade but my liver enzymes (ACT & ALT) both began to spike.  I was taken off Remicade as well as all pain meds and alcohol for 3 months....it was a very difficult time for me.  I like that the Orencia infusions only take 30 minutes.  I'm feeling even better than when I was on the Remicade.  My liver enzymes have been staying normal.  I'm praying that I can continue to stay on Orencia for a long time to come!

column2: ynnig, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this infusion for 3-1/2 yrs. and have had success; however I did get shingles and wonder if that may be a side effect.  I am not on methotrexate

column2: rheumatoidcutie, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was on this drug for about 15 months and it worked like a dream. I had used Humira for 6 months but I was constantly sick on it (colds/flus). Never experienced any increase in illnesses on Orencia, not to mention it restored my mobility and gave me back my life. Unfortunately, upon my 15th administration of Orencia I had a severe allergic reaction (anaphylactic shock!) and discontinued use. It has been hell without it and I'm scared to try anything else now but am considering Simponi because I don't want to live like this.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with RA at 21. Have been on Orencia for 3 years. It seemed to help initially, but it apparently does not stop further deteriation as advertised.  I have a sore that has not healed in 3 years.  Also had a rheumatoid nodule removed a year ago that still hasn't healed.  I'm unable to fight infection as Orencia has lowered immune system. I'm presently on heavy duty antibiotics.  Also have high blood pressure for first time ever. For the last year or so, treatments have not curbed pain. However, it's hard to know if RA would be worse without Orencia.  My feet are way worse now than when I started treatment.  Have taken prednisone for many years and also methotrexate. Now prescription pain pills are my only relief.  What to do now? God only knows!

column2: Tina, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had arthritis since I was 5 and I'm now 38. Have been on more drugs than I can remember taking. I took Orencia for 6 months. And developed cold/ flu like symt. After seeing my family dr and rhem. they treated me for broncthis. After 4 months of none stop coughing and be sick I went to the hospital. Was admitted and was diganosed with COPD and Asthma. And before the infusion I was healthly other than my RA. So please be careful if you plan on taking this medicine. If anyone else has the same smythoms I would like to know. Thanks

column2: Dana, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had RA for ten years. Was on Enbrel for about 7 years and did well but had to switch to Orencia due to severe reactions. The Orencia was much slower to work than the Enbrel- and during the first year or so I developed nodules but now they're getting much better. I do seem to have more of a problem with infections including a methotrexate mouth ulcer that became abcessed, more tooth cavities and an infected IV site. But the Orencia is finally working as well as the Enbrel (humira and remicade did not work at all for me).

column2: orpark, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started Orencia 2 months ago and have a headache all the time, sore throat, sinus pain, tired, don't quite feel myself all the time.  I think I will stop the treatments.  My RA is not serious except for knee pain.  Depemedrol shot once every 4 months works for me.  think I will continue this treatment until it does not work.  Have tried all the pill meds and nothing seems to work really well.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
jmr, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had an almost immediate improvement after each infusion. However, I now have lung complications and am currently checking that Orenciia is not contributing to this - I will be very upset if it is. My pain levels, ability to move freely and my energy levels have all improved during the time I have been having infustions

column2: sassybrat, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: my mom took 1 infusion of orencia, and died 3 weeks later due to complications from copd and pneumonia...everyone please beware of the negative effects this drug has, especially on the elderly.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It is probably to soon for me to make a fairstatement has I have only had 2 treatments so far and cannot feel much of a difference from Remicaid

column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Have been on Orencia for 2-3 yrs. Feeling really ok with the pain, able to work and support myself and enjoy the grandkids to an extent. Do my best. But now I have been having severe diareaha for abou 11 months and wonder if anyone has experienced this. I also have Crohns, going for a colonascopy within a week. Anyone else with this problem?

column2: Kitten3662, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Even though i havent been on orencia for very long, it really is not working for me. All i have gotten out of it is being sick for 3-4 days.

column2: ratom, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: On January 4, 2011 this will be my 32nd. infusion and my 21st year with RA. It took six weeks to fully start the medicine to begin with. I have taked several different medicines over the years and learned that one will not continue forever. Prior to Orencia, Humira was the thing that lasted for three years, then quit working. I take 15mg Methotrexate per week. No special diet or other meds and have tried several over the years. I do not live in an ideal climet to soften the arthritis peoblems. Michigan is not ideal as some warm, drier location. The type of RA is called Severe Acute Active Rheumatoid Arthritis and its all over. I got use to constant pain so the pain scale does not count any more. But doing well most of the time.

column2: Grateful, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 76 and I have been on Orencia for 18 months.  When I started Orencia I could not dress myself or get out of bed un-assisted.  I have been through all the other drugs including Mexotrexate and Embrel. Only Prednisone gave me relief, but the terrible side effects.  After starting Orencia, I have no need for Prednisone.  I am back to hiking at least a couple of miles per day.  My Rhumethoid nodules have just about disappeared.  God Bless Orencia. For me it has been wonderful.

column2: Chris, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It has taken 3 months but finally I think it's working. No flare ups recently and the side affects are decreasing too. I have had a lot of colds but it is worth it considering the pain relief. I was wondering if anyone else has cold symptoms a the time. Will it pass?

column2: Valerie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've been on Orencia for about 8 months now.  I feel a little better but the side effects are beginning to take it's toll.  Hair loss  (taking folic acid for this), fatigue (try to sleep as much as possible), I've gained weight and can't lose even if I eat salads all the time. The worst side effect is the sinus headaches!!! They have turned into 2 day migraines that I've had to go to the ER for.  I am happy I can move but what good is it if I'm sick with debilitating migraines.

column2: fiji, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Im in my 30s and have been on orencia for 10months now.I have had hair loss now for about 5 months.Intrestingly  enough I have lost 40 pounds.. Yes,LOST 40 pounds.I cant find anyone else i have read has lost weight.My back has got worse,all the way down my spine its bad. Now the arthritis is starting in my jaw joint.Is this happening to anyone else?The hair loss is traumatic.Not all yet~!So,I dont know if I should change medication or not?I have been on plaquenil,remicade,enbrel,and humira.Humira injections were horrible!Way to painful!! I will pray for u all and hope u pray for me.Good luck..

column2: bjs, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: My sister has RA.  She started with Humira six yrs ago.  Five yrs ago had breast cancer (L breast removed & several lymph nodes) So far she's a 5 year survivor.  She's been on several RA meds and for 6 months has had Orencia infusions.  She feels her movement has improved a little.  She's now in the hospitl with breathing & lung problems.  She had a quart & 1/2 of bloody liquid from her right lung.  She's supposed to get the results of that tonight.  She has a blood clot on her right knee and is being treated with a blood thinner (Lovinox).  Has had a port inserted for easy access for blood work & IVS.  Fluid flows in but cannot be pulled out.  ie for blood work. ?? I ask that anyone who considers these meds to REALLY consider all the side effects.  She thought that they would help with her RA pain which, did a little.  But she's now thinking they were not worth the risk of these serious side effects.  PLEASE consider them carefully. My sister is 70 years old and has always been healthy.

column2: BLUMBAR, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: MY SHORT TERM MEMORY SEEMS LESS CANT THINK OF RIGHT WORDS,NAMES,LOOSE TRACK OF THOUGHT

column2: Vikki, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with RA, FMS and CTS at 28yo. Have been on humira, embrel, infliximab, rituximab...so many I'm even forgetting the names. only thing that worked was inflixi but at 6th infusion got serious allergic reaction and it was discontinued.  Am starting Orencia next week and am so terrified of weight gain.  On morphine patches for pain but the damage to my joints has continued through all these biologics. Don't know what to do anymore :(

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My RA symptoms have decreased significantly after 6 monthes of treatment.  However, my blood pressure has elevated to dangerous levels and the BP is not controlled with meds.

column2: trixie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had RA sense I was 22 I am now 37 and I have used so many Ra meds that didn't work. ORENCIA has been a dream. Does anyone one else get this drug with sulo medrol injected when getting this drug?

column2: rquiroga, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've been on orenica for 9 months and it's has allowed me to remain very active but lately I have been losing alot of hair. Even though I walk about 2 hours almost everyday,I still can't lose weight. I'm thinking of changing meds.

column2: jane, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: will have 4th infusion next wk.  no noticeable improvement. headaches & higher bp.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Taken many medications for RA over 34 years. Orencia has produced no infections, but have gained weight and now issues with constipation. have breakthrough pain and sweeling after 3 weeks.

column2: happygramma, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had RA for over ten years and have been on most of the drugs out there. have been on Orencia for three years and have gone into remission twice. Weight gain has been a problem but only one dress size. I have started having problem with my blood pressure and irregular ekg and wonder if the drug is effecting it.Go for a stress test this week to see what is going on with my heart. Best thing I have been on. so far

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This treatment at best is only a partial success and doesn't justify the expense, side effects, and time off from work.

column2: Tom Janes, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: tomjanes4428@sbcglobal.net On Orencia 2 years this month of July. working well now as it did take about 6 months to start working. On Humira for 4 years and it also worked well then all of a sudden quit working. I do notice some discomfort and some constant pain of which is well tolerated. On Methotrexate for over 15 years taking along with other meds and now with Orencia. At 72 in August I think I am well adjusted to Orencia.  Was at first afraid to take it. If Medicare and my insurance should take Orencia away I have not idea of what to do yet. Over the last two months my doctor and his crew that I have seen for 20 years got let go at Borgess Hospital, bad deal for all of us seeing this doctor.

column2: Judy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had RA for about 22 years and have tried everything.  Enbrel lasted 2 years, Remicade lasted 6.5 years!!  However, joint destruction has continued.  I was very healthy on Remicade but after 2 infusions of Orencia I have had serious infections.  First a tooth abstract, then an infection in my right foot.  The One joint that is better is my left wrist!! I am undergoing foot surgery at this time and am taking time off of Orencia.  Do not know what to think??

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 16 and i start orencia in about a week.i dont want to get fat and have my hair fall out

column2: Dotz, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Have had RA about 4 yrs.  Tried Humira and Enbrel; didn't work.  Remicade worked, then stopped.  Started Orencia about 2 years ago and it has been a miracle for me.  With it and pain meds I have my life back.  Before, it was a struggle to walk; couldn't hardly use my hands.  Now most people would think I am "normal"  Only I know about my pain.  I have my knees drained 2-3 times a year.Side effects;  aggravating headache; dry skin; Weight Gain (yes it bothers me, but I choose it over severe pain); fatigue; red dots some pimple-like on my face; ringing in ears. BP is very good!! But like I said, I have my life back with some restraints; but not constant, disabling pain. I am very blessed and hope you will be if you try Orencia.  Don't be afraid, it might work work you.

column2: Ladybo7, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on Orencia for over 6 months now. I have noticed a change in my symptons. My levels have all come down. I have even come off of prednisone. Which I am happy about. I still have a lot of swelling in my ankles and my knee hurts a lot. So I almost believe it is something more then RA.

column2: JoAnn, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am on Orencia for 11 month now. First 9 month I felt much better, stiffness and pain were manageable. The only thing is: I was always thin and now I am 25 pd heavier. My RA Dr tells me that she did not see anyone gaining weight on this drug, but I do not believe. I met so many people who complain about same thing. And because I gained so much weight I developed high BP. I had to say good bye to 90/60 (for all 55 years) and now I am 165/100 for most of the time.  Plus, for the last 3 month I developed bad side effects: sore throat, thrush, severe sweating,swollen glands, dizziness, severe pains all over my body especially my legs, hands and feet. I am very unhappy about this treatment and will definitely ask my DR to switch me to something else. I was on Enbrel shots, they did not make me sick, but did not help at all. I was also on Prednisone + Meth. I was sick, but at least I did not gained any weight, in fact I lost. My Dr says that i have to choose if I want to feel better or worry about my weight. I think this is wrong, because having high BP from gaining weight is a killer for me, I have heart condition. So what good does it do to me if instead of RA only, I also get other health issues from it? The whole situation is very disappointing to me. Sorry, I wish to give you better news, but i believe we come here to get right information so I am honestly give you my personal opinion. All the best to all of you!

column2: joseph, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
Bella, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was on Orencia by now for 11 month. First 7 month I did feel better, no doubt although I gained a great amount of weight. I do not believe my Dr when she says that you don't gain weight from it. I eat very little, move same as always, no way I can gain this much in short period of time. But the last 3 month I am suffering with more pain especially the first 4-6 days after the treatment. The first 2 days I hardly can eat or move at all, I don't know if this worth to take anymore. I am totally disappointed in this drug and wouldn't use it again. For all above reasons. Thank you and feel better all!

column2: Turbo, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
RA Pt, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This drug worked for me just fine. But it DID cause weight gain - for ME. I gained a pound a month, every month that I was on it. Now that I'm off Orencia, I have lost five pounds in eight months. The doctors can explain it away any way they want. The drug causes weight gain FOR SOME PEOPLE. It did for me.

column2: noeltner2@charter.net, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: HELP IM LOSING MY HAIR, AND HAVE SCERICOUS, AND MOUTH SORES. ARE THESE SIDE AFFECTS?

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Instead of this drug helping me; it has hurt me.  I have pain in my legs and feet.  My blood pressure is always too high.  I have had a Sinus Infection for about 3 months that I cannot get rid of no matter what antibiotic I am given.  This medication has been a great disappointment to me.

column2: CathyJ, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've had two infusions of Orencia.  I dont feel better at all.  I feel somewhat worse in a different way.  I keep getting pains through my legs and hands.  After infusion I was very sick to my stomach.  And during the infusion I kept getting terrible pains all over my body.  So far I'm waiting for a positive reaction!  I have been on Enbrel, Humira, Remicade and large doses of Methotrexate which I can no longer take because of its adverse reaction

column2: ladybo7, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Just started orencia month and half ago. I have had energy, and less pain. I tried Humira and it worked some at first, but the injections were painful. I was very fearful of the infusion cause I hate IV's but just last weekend, I walked a little over a mile with my family. I haven't been able to do that since I have diagnosed over a year ago. Life has been restored back to me. I will CONQUER this disease. I will not allow it to rule my life anymore.  Remission here I come. :-)

column2: LindaV, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 55 years old, was Diagnosed with RA 2 years ago. Was on Methrotixate (sp?) for 5 month, did not work for me at all; instead was making me so ill, I couldn't eat and got bad case of anemia and also lost my hair. Than I went on Ebrel shots and tried them for 4 month, but did not get any relieve. I am on Prednisone for 2 years, on low doses at this point.After starting Orencia I felt good after about 4th treatment. Even though I have to travel once a month to NYC, I don't mind to do it because it working for me! Finally I can walk better, have less pain, have more strength.I was very worry about gaining weight. My wonderful Rheumy explained to me that Orencia doesn't make people gaining weight. It's our overall tiredness and pain prevents from moving and being more active. In some people pain causing depression and depression well known for causing overeating. I am not a Dr by any means, but I think she is right. I did not gained any weight even though i am on high doses of Orencia plus Prednisone.  Maybe cutting calories and become as active as we can may help with weight gain? I wish to have the answer. But this is my experience with Orenica IV infusions.Best of luck to all of you as well!

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

column2: thefmi@aol.com, 65-74 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using Orencia for over two  year; it has been a wonderful drug for meand I have experienced no side effects. For the most part my RA pain and fatique have disappeared.Now, today, advised by my infusion center, that Noridian is suspending medicare coverage for the drug, while they review it.Don't know what that is about, but nothing else has worked very well for me.

column2: nanare, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a Registered Nurse diagnosed in 7/08. and have been on Enbrel, Humira, MTX(unable to take because of liver damage) Prdenisone 60mg/day for 4 weeks and was crippled and flaring for the last 3 monthss and unable to move or do daily activities. Started Orencia 1 mo ago and will receive my 3rd dose in a week. I have had a great change in my symptoms, back at work, no side effects accept headache. I have gained 8 pounds, not since Orencia but also on high doses of Prednisone for 3 months. I have a moon face but I am encouraged by the results of Orencia. I hope to be weaned from my Prednisone and will not have the severs flare up I have experienced.  I feel these treatments are so individual. I thank God I can get out of bed each day! Time will tel, and hopefully i will continue this drug with minimal side effect. Thought I would never be able to function again.

column2: Brenda, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm so very thankful for this drug. I was on methotrexate(shot) but after 6 month all my hair fell out & it wasn't working I still had alot of imflamation in my hand, but after one month of infusion of orencia, I don't have as much inflamation or swelling.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have lupus and rheumatoid arthritis and started Orencia when it first came out. By the second infusion my pain was gone, my energy returned and the damage stopped getting worse.  The medicine may be more effective for people like me who have both RA and SLE.  I haven't had any infections and don't get sick.  I have gained some weight (from size 2 to size 4).  I am trying to get it to level off since I can work out now.  People just starting it should watch their diet and start a workout program as soon as their symptoms improve!  My only complaint is that it requires an IV.  I am a business executive and it is hard to carve out the time every month.

column2: Belle, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I stopped using Orencia five months ago. I had been on it for two years and gained twenty pounds - had ALWAYS been thin. The good news is I haven't gained ANY more weight since I stopped Orencia. The bad news is I only lost a few pounds so far in five months on another RA med.

column2: Scandy,  Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Leaves me tried the week after the infusion. I have been on it for 10 months w/Placquenel & am experiencing my first major infection. Had t ogo to my GP and get an antibiotic to help me oversome sinuitis & brochitis. It is slowly i mproving.

column2: sharon, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: omg I am scared to death I start this med next week but I am going to be fat and bald! I am aLREADY  TRYING TO LOSE WEIGHT  AND AM A BIT HEAVIER THAN WHAT i SHOULD BE ABOUT 20 LBS ! The info the dr gave me today does not say any thing about weight gain is this typical?

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am 30 years old suffering from RA for approximately 4 years. I am moving like someone without RA. I am a special education teacher.  I can get on the floor without any pain.  I love this medicine!

column2: jewelk23, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Orencia IV for 18 months now and getting more miserable as time goes on.  I ache so bad I can't stand it and I have gained 25 lbs ! I have tried so many of the other RA drugs with allergic results or no results.  I see my RA dr next week - I don't know what to do anymore ?

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug for about a year now and I love it.  The first few months I did start losing my hair but it has stopped.  I did gain a few pounds but I am starting to lose it now. I get headaches with each treatment so I just come home and rest for the rest of the day.  I can work 40 hrs a week now instead of 25-30, I can do so much more with kids and can plan more activities throughout the day.  I hardly ever swell anymore and I haven't had to take presnisone for 11 months.  I think that the side effects are worth me being able to spend more time living a normal life. I have had RA for 10 years.

column2: Good2Go, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed w/ RA in Feb. '09.  Have been on two 5 mg. of Prednisone since (now mid-Nov.).  I was reluctant to try Orencia IV due to reading webmd and seeing how many women have complained of hair loss and weight gain from it.  I have had 2 Orencia infusions and have been losing hair right about the time I had the first one.  My dr. thinks it's caused from what my body is experiencing at this time (incl. Prednisone).  Spoke w/ Bristol-Myers rep. and they report that they did not find hair loss a problem in their preliminary studies. They took a report from me for documentation. Will probably have to change RA med. Has Prednisone cause anyone hair to fall out??

column2: designsdeg, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am scheduled to start Orencia IV and I am terrified of it not working and the side effects of gaining weight. I have used Humira for 5 years and it worked wonderfully until it wore off. I tried Enbrel and it did not do a thing. I also take metotraxate, mobic, and cymbalta.

column2: saranac3, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 55 and have had RA since the age of 5. I have been on most of the drug treatments there are for it. Prednisone is the most consistantly helpful but it has nasty side effects long term. Enbrel worked very well for nearly ten years before wearing off as all RA drugs seem to do. Humira did nothing but it was the first time I experienced the facial rash. I thought it was a lop-sided cold sore as it was near my mouth at first. I switched to Orencia in March 2009. Ten treatments later, I am now having a severe flare, a facial rash by mouth, cheeks, and eyes (including top eyelid), more frequent night urination, ringing in my ears, and extreme fatigue right after treatment. It is a very expensive treatment with no improvement so far, actually worse...may quit soon but not sure what there is left to try. Is anyone trying to perfect prednisone (it's side effects) or is all the research going toward the genetically engineered, high tech stuff?

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Been On This Drug For About 6 months. GetExtreme Fatigue After Each Infusion & After Last Infusion Got Extreme Nausea, Heartburn& Flu Like Sympyoms.  Not So Sure I Can StayOn This Drug Much Longer.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
rasurvivor, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am a RA patient and was diagnosed in 2000. My quality of life went from a very active person to one that could barely walk, dress myself, or do many of the everyday things that a normal healthy female adult takes for granted.  I have been through a lot of the meds out there.  Asprin, prednisone, methotrexate, embrel, and a handful of others to name a few.  I was almost at the end of the line for medications when my rheumatologist suggested I try Orencia.  I can vouch that it did take about 6 mos. to kick in, but the results are very positive.  My side effects are a bit of high blood pressure, cold sores that come and go, and a nodule that I have just noticed.  But overall, my quality of life has improved 80% compared to what RA could potentially do to me.  My X-rays have shown that my joints have not been affected since taking the drug for over two years.  Give this a try if you are out of options and hang in there because it does take time.

column2: emescall, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: swelling and pain in back

column2: jenrile, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I became very depressed and anxious when I started the Orencia, I mentioned it to the women who gives me the IV and she bit my head off, she said that wasn't a side effect. Wondering if this happened to anyone else?

column2: Carole, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I consistently wore a size 4 and blasted through wearing a size 6.  Now I wear an 8 or 10 or 12.  I gained approximately 35 pounds since April 2009 which is when I began Orencia.  I do not have any other side effects.  I don't know when the gaining of weight will end so I may stop taking this drug.  I am miserable because of the weight gain.

column2: Sunny, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've been taking Orencia for about eight months now.  Still have some pain, but no swelling. No side effects. I do experience fatigue and depression but that could be from having the R.A. Was hoping that the Orencia would help more with the pain.My medicare insurance does pay for this.I am running out of options as the med insurance will only pay for IV infusions and not the shots like Embrel or Humira. I tried Remicade and it was wonderful! I felt human again and was able to do most everything but like so many others I became allergic to it.  I hope this review helps someone. All the Best!

column2: jenrile, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I too, have experienced extreme depression and anxiety the only thing that has changed is that I started Orencia. I have had 3 treatments and am wondering if there is a connection....

column2: susieq255, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 51 yrs. old and was diagnosed with RA at age 39.  I've tried it all, and been on Prednisone for over 6 yrs., with a 40+ weight gain.  Became a grandmother for the first time this past Oct. and wanted so much to hold my granddaughter with no pain.  Orencia is wonderful! My hands feel the best the have felt in many years after 4 months of treatment.  My feet still a problem. I have dropped my Prednisone down to 1mg, and not even every day.  My weight is dropping finally! My hair loss I blame on Methotrexate, for I still take this also. My hot flashes I blame to Menopause! My only side effect I have, and I'm not sure it is the drug is severe heart burn.

column2: Mary, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Very effective except the good effect wore off too early and there was no way to increase the dose. THE ONLY NEGATIVE SIDE EFFECT I EXPERIENCED WAS WEIGHT GAIN. NO HAIR LOSS. NO DEPRESSION. NO OTHER NEGATIVE EFFECT AT ALL. Many good effects, but I couldn't stand the never ending weight gain, so I switched off and am hoping to lose the weight.

column2: Good2Go, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with RA in Feb.  Dr. prescribed Prednisone.  Had me have ultrasoundand liver biopsy to see if I could handle taking RA drugs.  It is Aug., and I'm STILL on Prednisone.  Have moonface, gained 10# and swollen.  Hardly helps pain.  I'm due to go on Orencia this week and am very concerned, reading here about so much weigght gain and hair loss.  Does everyone experience this???

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am  wondering if anyone has experienced severe depression and anxiety with this drug.  I just started it and it has been really bad.  But, not sure if that is the problem.  Thanks.

column2: BLIMP, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i WOULD LIKE TO KNOW IF ANYONE ELSE HAS HAD A DRAMACTIC WEIGHT GAIN WITH THIS DRUG? i HAVE GAINED 15 POUNDS IN 4 MONTHS OF STARTING THIS DRUG.

column2: Carole, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This site has enlightened me.  I have gained 35 pounds and feel am out of my mind!  Nothing fits and I now feel horrible because of my weight!  I am so tired of trade offs and the expense of all of it.  I just want to get off of everything.  I have hired a personal trainer but will I be shoveling $$ against the tide because of Orencia??  I do feel more energetic; my hands feel swollen but useful; my feet hurt; RA MD thinks we are on the right path.  Unbelievable...I was not aware weight gain could occur on Orencia.  The drug is expensive; new clothing every few months, ai yi yi; a personal trainer $$$$.  I am now depressed!!

column2: Linda, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was on Meth for 6 month; I felt very sick all the time and very tired. Started to loose my hair, nausea prevented me from enjoying my days at all. Than I was switched to Enbrel shots, I had no side effects at all, but my Ra told me that if it did not work for 3 month most likely it will not work for me and suggested Orencia Infusions. This wasn't a good experience at all: nausea, hair lose, weight gained and very rapidly. After each treatment I was in bed for at least 3 days with flue like symptoms, nausea, dizziness, headache every single day. I wasn't as tired as I was on Meth, but other side effects made me very unhappy. I always been skinny, so all this weight gained made me very unhappy. I been on  Orencia for 8 month. Pain wise I am absolutely the same, I did not notice any help in that department, but for me personally side effects are not worth to go on with this medicine. I read other rates and I am happy to read that some people get good results with it, but I have to stop and try Enbrel+Prednisone again. I don't believe that gaining weight is good for anybody, it can cause other problems especially if you have heart condition like I do.Best of luck to everybody on Orencia, hope it will work wonders for you!

column2: pearle47, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am experiencing severe hair loss especially since last infusion 11 days ago

column2: Jenn, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am glad to hear from this board that others have had significant weight gain taking Orencia. I have been slender all my life, yet I have gained 1 to 2 pounds per month (for 22 months) since I started Orencia. New clothes every few months are not easy to afford! I knew I wasn't overeating, but I didn't understand it because weight gain was never listed as a side effect for Orencia. I told my doctor that I couldn't take the weight gain anymore. So, I am getting ready to switch to a self injectable drug -- probably Humira.

column2: greatmama, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My menstrual cycle has become very irregular, every 4-6 weeks and lasting 1-4 days.  Hair thinning and hair loss, hot all the time, break out into sweat, and I have on and off tingling/prickly sensation all over my body.  My rheum says it can't be the Orencia and won't let me go to something else.  All labs test (including thyroid were normal), i know it's the orencia.  Time to switch MD's....

column2: OrenciaIV, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Orencia for four months.After one mo. I got a rash on my feet and legs.Then hair began falling out. Drs.gave me salves/should have stopped med.6mos.after stopping O., rash and extreme hair loss continue.

column2: Tallytownmomof2, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with RA four years ago at age 42. I have been taking Prednisone, then Plaquenil was added and finally Methotrexate and Folic Acid. I continued to have joint pain, inflamation and fatigue. My doctor suggested Enbrel last spring. I was on it for 5 months. It did not help. I started the Orencia in November of 2008, it tooks about 5 months for it to finally start working but for the last two months I have had little pain and don't need to sleep as many hours.I am taking little or no vicodin for the pain.  I get a headache for several days after the treatment but that is the only side effect I have noticed and the headache is manageable with Tylenol or Vicodin, if it is a really nasty one. I see my rheumatologist at the end of this month and he plans to take me off the prednisone if I am doing well, which I expect he will agree I am. I would recommend anyone who has RA that has not responded to other treatments give Orencia a try if their doctor recommends it. It takes 4-6 months to really start making a difference but it does help!

column2: tishntenn, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Though there is no cure for RA, Orencia has helped more than any other drug.  I can make plans for social events usually without a problem.  I have more energy, less fatigue, and seem to have more desire to do things. (because I feel better)  Generally, about a week before my treatment is due I can feel its effectiveness decreasing, though not to the point of where I was pre-treatment.  Then, for a couple of days after treatment I feel more fatigue and achy.  That gradually subsides and I have 2-3 good weeks where I can visit my friends, go to the store, and feel pretty productive.

column2: Paula, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had RA for 5 years now.  Embrel was a joke, Remicade was heaven (has to stop because of tingling in feet), and Orencia is OK.  I am much more tired, still swell somewhat.  Since I have been on Orencia I have had a sinus infection every month, a rash on my face, bruise at a touch, and am getting little, red dots on my face.  I see the Doctor on MOnday and am going to demand Remicade back.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug for a couple of years and it is working great.  My hands don't hurt and I have tons of energy.  I would recommend it to anyone with arthritis!!!

column2: 2twins, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Never felt any different after an infusion.  Never felt re-energized. Flares still occured frequently. Have used Enbrel (stopped working), and Remicade (absolutely loved it, the best, but wound up having allergic reaction.  Now looking into Rituxin with hopes of effects like Remicade,

column2: realdixichic@bellsouth.net, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am about to start taking this and wondered about the side effects

column2: SKC, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 56 years old. Was diagnosed with RA in '93, Crohn's Disease in '91, MS in '89. I have taken Methotrexate since '93. I tried Remicade but stopped because my BP would bottom out each time.  Also tried Humira but stopped after 1st treatment due to an alergic reaction-my arms felt like they were on fire or filled with hot lead, and then it began to spread to my legs and spine.  I just took my 8th Orencia treatment and the only improvement I see is that I am sleeping more than 2 hours before the pain wakes me.  I don't feel as fatigued, but the pain is still horrendous.  I have gained 15 lbs., have a recurring itching rash all over my face, and a recurring yeast infection in the folds of my skin.  I always have a nagging cough and a bitter aftertaste for about a week after the treatments.  I haven't been able to find anything to control the bad breath or heartburn. I promised my Dr. I would stick it out for 6-8 treatments, which I have done.  I don't think the price is justified, nor the claims the drug makes.  I wonder if it is just another selling hype by the drug company. I wish the best of luck to anyone who tries Orencia or any of the other drugs I mentioned.  Sometimes they work, sometimes they don't.  I do believe that Methotrexate has been the most help to me, but alas, it seems to have lost it's strength. Thus the reason for trying others.  May God help us all to find a relief from this nightmare, and in the meantime, may he help the Dr's and the drug companies who continue to help us conquer the diseases that seek to destroy our lives.  So try what you must, and GOOD LUCK!

column2: joyful-journey, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Orencia for 2 years.  It  has taken over 10 years to find a medication that works for me.  If it is on the market, I have tried it.  I also take Clinoril and Plaquinil, along with Vicodin when the pain is extreme. It took 4 to 6 months to work but now I am able to work a full day without naps, I have been able to start going up and down stairs, a previous impossibility without taking forever.  I can walk long distances and don't have to park in the h/c spot or not go out at all.  I have been able to join a gym and start swimming and have lost 64 pounds.  I was very discouraged at first because it didn't seem to want to work, but I stuck it out and am glad I did.  It does start to wear off the last week and I find the chronic pain (which I am able to deal with since it is still better than it was)gets a little bit worse.  I have, however, weighed the unsuccessful treatments of 10 years and the associated pain and am quite happy.  Since there is no cure for R/A, I am willing to accept the pain since I can once again move and do the things I enjoy with less pain and effort. It still becomes a balancing act.  If I do too much one day, I know I will not be able to do much the next.  That is all part of the disease that I have learned to deal with.

column2: HONEY BEE, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I AM GOING TO HAVE MY THIRD ORENCIA IV TOMORROW.  SO FOR THE ONLY SIDE AFFECT IS BEING TIRED MORE.  I WAS ON EMBREL BUT IT QUIT WORKING.  HAAS ANYBODY DEVELOPED ANY RED DOTS THAT LOOK LIKE LITTLE BLOOD BLITZER.  THEY CANNOT FIGURE WHAT IT IS.  I AM GOING TO GIVE IT A COUPLE MORE TRYS AND SEE HOW THINGS GO.

column2: Kathryn, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
Dee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was on Humira, taken off and started with Orencia and it was working until I started to get nodules on my legs and have gained 11 pounds. I am off Orencia now and trying to lose the weight.  Has anyone experienced either of the above? Thank you

column2: SandyRA, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 48 and have had RA since 20--been through most drugs--Remicade rebounded and took me all the way down to immobile.  Been on Orencia since August 2009--doing much better, no cane now and able to work full day.  But, I do have to watch festering for minor scratches and my weight is up 30 lbs--don't know if it is connected.  All the drugs I have ever taken have side effects that must be managed...but I am able to dress, work and most importantely hug my children and stand to be touched by them.The infusions are an hour away--only 30 minutes long (Remicade were 3.5 hours) I make a day of it and do errands in that area. I feel it is better than taking up 17 tablets a day or 2 to 3 self injections per week.Has anyone else gained much weight on Orencia?  How have you managed it?

column2: Susanne, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have previously been on Enbrel and saw improvement in 2 weeks with Orencia I have seen no improvement in 6 months. I do not believe this drug lives up to patient expectabtiions and will probably discontinue it after this next dose if I feel no better.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Remacaid and had to stop because of side effects (flu like lasting 48 hours after infusion)  Started Orencia per Dr's recommendation and at first it didn't work, got worse had to go on prednisone. Dr asked me to hang in there for six months.  This month is number 5 and it has kicked in!  I am not in as much pain and I am quite pleased.  I also take methotrexate.

column2: LegalGal01, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Nothing has helped me in the 5 years since I was diagnosed.  This was my last hope.  I was on it for 6 months and feel worse than ever.  I feel that even my pain meds stopped working.  I'm going back to Humira where at least it took the edge off my pain.

column2: Ga4J@aol.com, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on Orencia since August of '08. Previously I have been on Humira, but my doctor thought perhaps Orencia might work better. I have all the common side effects, but in addition have gained about 15 lbs. since starting the Orencia program. Are there any others out ther who have experienced weight gain with this drug?

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 48 year ld woman with RA for 20 years.  On Orencia since Oct, 08.  It's working but I suffer from chronic bacterial vaginal infections after infusion.  Has anyone else experieced this?  I don't want to stop taking it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
Beth, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had only 2 infusions 2 wks apart.  A little nausea, fatigue and mouth sores, but that is just part of the Methetrexate injection 1x week.  Tried most everything else in the last 4 years...51 yofemale.  This is looking good and I am delighted.  I can turn over in my sleep.

column2: rkz6wc, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Since I started this I am having bone fractures.  Is there a connection for this to the medicine?

column2: Kai Ferano, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I'm 63 years old and have been on Orencia for about 1.5 years.  So far it's helped.  I'm mobile and generally don't experience alot of joint pain.  I haven't noticed any negative side effects except for a mild sore throat the night of the day of my once-a-month infusion.  I also take methotraxate and Plaquenil.

column2: Frosted Lady, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 66 year old female. I have been on various meds in the past several years. Last year, it was Methotraxate and Remicade for 6 months with no results. Then, it was changed to Arencia and the Methotraxate. I must drive an hour each way for the infusion. It has been nearly 3 months, but nothing has changed. In fact, pain is worse. After each infusion, my blood pressure sky-rockets, and I have a rash on my forearms that looks like a diaper rash. I have had a constant cough since I started with the Remicade, and it still has not ceased. They still claim I must stay on it for another 3 months to give it a real chance. I am very tired all the time it seems.

column2: rsmith, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Orencia for over a year, after having been on Methotrexate (made me nauseous) and Remicade (wonderful but stopped working after 7 years), and still take Arava.  I am very lethargic and want to sleep forever after a treatment. I also have a perpetual intensive cough. Going to see pulmonologist soon to see if related.

column2: jay, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: waears off after 3 weeks

column2: twinkle, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I could be a poster child for this drug. I can finally close my hands,get up&down from a chair and dress myself. I get a little headache and funny taste in my mouth, but I can walk and walk and lift my grand kids without hurting. What a blessing

column2: rocky1, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on orencia for a year now I got pneumonia when I started it,my doctor wants me to start remicade but with my immune system I am afraid I will get the same reaction as I did with orencia. Has anyone ever had this problem when switching these medications.I need some info before I decideto try this medication.

column2: Pia87, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on Orencia (IV) for about 1 year.  It is given to me once a month.  When I started being treated I never associated a rash or dryness of my skin or scalp.  I went to a dermatologist because I started to get a red line around my hair line and the dermatologist told me it was stress.  She gave me a cream and I used it.  It would clear the redness but only until I received another treatment of Orencia.  Now for the past few months I have been getting worse with a terrible rash on my face and neck.  I coutinued using the cream from the dermatologist but seem to believe it is the Orencia that I am getting this reaction from.  It itches and I try to take Benadryl to stop the itch.  I can't sleep because of this.  I am also loosing my hair.  Thank you for listening.

column2: Tom Janes, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: 20 years using several meds most all did work at one time. Humira quit working switched to Orencia in July 08 so far working reasonably well. Infusion is simple and no side effects. Still get mild pains and swelling. On Methotrexate injection also combination I feel is super so far.

column2: do615, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I feel alittle better. not much. all other meds didnt work. this makes my hair fall out and gave me a cough. research this before you determine it is right for you.

column2: mary, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Orencia for about a year and  a half.  I feel very good and have no side effects that I am aware of.  I have high energy and a small amount of pain.  It seems in the fall I have pain but then it passes.  I take this inconjuction with Methotresxate and folic acid...no sores in my mouth, no nausea, just tired the day of the infusion.

column2: keylimepie1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had four infusions so far. ( after being on Humira and that didn't help too much)I noticed that after my fourth infusion my body aching has subsided but joints still hurt a lot. I am not giving up on this drug! Doc. says it takes time to work well, but does continually.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I experience extreme nausea-so after the 1st treatment they give me an anti nausea shot and I no longer have that problem- also if I spend the day doing very little I have found less fatigue.  I am one who is allergic to 98% of RA Meds-so still have a few flares, but just had 6th treatment and am doing pretty good- but I can tell when it is wearing off- and look forward to the treatment.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I could not take Humira because I had, and still have Histoplasmosis present but dormant in my lungs.Although Orencia is not contraindicated with Orencia use, I am taking an antifungal to be on the safe side. So happy to be on Orencia. I have had 4 treatments. Only side effect is a strange taste in my mouth for the first 4 or more days. Last treatment a soreness of my tounge . Always a headache on and off for week or so. Frequent urination at night. Very effactive in treating my RA. High energy level and little severe stiffness and joint pain. Best of all no more feeling like I have the flu all the time. Life has promise again.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had severe pain and was in a wheel chair. I started taking orencia and was able to walk again. I have virtually no pain. Praise The Lord !!!!!

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 44 year old female and have had RA since I was 29.  Been through most all of the meds - Enbryl worked with the Arava until I developed a possible side effect and thus doc switched to Orencia.  It took 1 month before it started to help and then works great until time for next infusion.  I still take with Arava.  I had pain down front of my legs almost nightly until started this and it went away.  Also, the manufacturer has a great assistance program - one for those without ins. and also to cover co-pays if you are covered.  It is a lifesaver as otherwise I could not afford it.

column2: Limo, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: inconvenience of traveling, waiting on the infusion and immediate after effects are all difficult.For the amount of money I feel that I should be in much better condition than I am.Very expensive

column2: Becky, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 55 and have been dx since 35. This is the first treatment that has even started working. Also on Arava. First three days have headache, extreme fatigue then slowly feel better. I have had three treatments. Nothing else has worked. i even have progressive damage in hands and feet during Remicade. Hope things will be looking up.

column2: cag, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After 5 infusions I have to say the drug is well tolerated with just a dull headache the night of the infusion and lessening of effectiveness near the end of the month cycle. I have some new tendonitis but overall better movement.

column2: lady tee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i,m a 40 year old female. i've been on orencia since the end of 4/08. it's been wonderful sofar. but now i experience having feeling frequent urinating at night while sleeping is anyone else having this problem?

column2: hello, 19-24 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column9: hi ths is my second review

column2: Jim, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with RA at the age of 31. I've been on remicade,enbrel,humira,& all the pills. This Orencia so far has kept me from having those nightmare flare ups that used to make me contemplate having my extremities simply amputated. That's how bad it got when the other meds stopped working. I was at the end of my rope. No one really understands the severe pain I was having. Orencia, so far has brought me back to the living, but so did all the other meds for periods of time. I pray that this Orencia will continue to stay effective. Its great to walk among the living again!!!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on the drug for 6 months now and I feel great!!!  My hands hardly hurt at all anymore (I'm typing better than I ever have).  No having to stick myself with a needle - I let my doctors office do that.  It did take about 2 months to start feeling the improvements but it was worth it.  My energy level is way up too.

column2: KimMcKissack, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had RA for over 30 years. I have used just about every drug available. I have been on Orencia for about 9 months. I take it in addition to Arava and Mobic. I am very happy with the results. I have not had a flare for several months!

column2: maddie, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I just had my 4th infusion.  My joints are killing me. I wish I had stayed on humira 1x a week...but at least I am still able to walk for now.

column2: glumbr, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It is an extremely expensive medication not covered by insurance.  The co-pay offered by the manufacturer does not even touch the cost. Over $4000.00

column2: grandee, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: I have been on this for about a year.  I still take medicadation for pain.  After invesion I have a very nauseous stomach for a dAY OR 2

column2: m ari, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: my pain is better but the side effects i'm having is like no others written. i'm fatigue, weak, to the point that i feel i'm not going to make it thur my work day.

column2: SaraLConverse, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've been on Orencia 7 months and notice that my swollen joints have subsided.... but after the first treatment, I got sores in my mouth that went away but then  my face broke out with a rash that comes and goes, but never really goes away... it looks like I have a bad diaper rash on my face around my mouth, nose, and it is now affecting my eyes..people do look strange at me now.  Doctor says I should keep trying for another 3 months...  Anyone else have the same reactions?I've had R/A for 22 years....

column2: Rich, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been using this medication since it was first released. I also take Mobic and methotraxate injections once a week (easier than pills/less side effects). It has helped me get back to my hobbies and a more normal life.

column2: mininator@hotmail.com, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Pain is not controlled.  Program is underdeveloped.  Using the in home care infusion program and they don't show up, or call.  The medicine is having so far about a 68% success rate with all joints but wrists and elbows.  Wouldn't advise starting the program until they are able to accomodate the patients they currently have.

column2: yingyanglily, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: At the moment it has been doing the job of subsiding inflamtion but the painnot so well anymore. i am afraid that something else will have to be used to ease the pain besides inflamation.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have tried Humira and Remicade and had to stop due to bad reactions. So far Orencia has been terrific, just hope my body doesn't reject it later too. I have energy and little to no joint pain. I have been receiving the IV's for less than 1 year.

column2: Ty, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I get sores in my mouth the day after treatment that last for weeks.I am unable to eat and it is painfull.

column2: squaw on the war path., 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was 36 years old when I found out that I have RA. I'm glad I was put on this study. I   was on a drug study for this drug. And it has help me very much. But now my study is done and I cant afford to do it anymore. So Im trying to find help so I can keep getting my infusions. It is a wonderful drug because I don't hurt nomore. I hope it helps others.

column2: sstewart, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on Orencia for three months now (four infusions). My doctor feels I should give it six months to see whether it is going to help, but my RA symptoms are getting increasinly worse. I'm trying to find out whether anyone else has actually experienced a worsening of symptoms due to Orencia, to help me decide whether to give this more time.
